abstracts.cdata!:
The Irrigation Rehabilitation Project
            will: (a) increase agricultural production by raising farm
            productivity through rapid rehabilitation of the existing
            irrigation and drainage infrastructure; (b) alleviate
            poverty by increasing income of small private farmers and
            creating employment opportunities for dependent farm labor
            in rural areas; and (c) ensure the long-term sustainability
            of irrigation and drainage investments through farmer
            participation in operation and maintenance, efficient system
            management and adequate cost recovery. In order to achieve
            the above the project will specifically focus on: (a) system
            rehabilitation; (b) institutional development; (c) policy
            support; and (d) implementation support.
